oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Correspondence between Governor Hill McAlister and President Franklin D. Roosevelt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Telegram from Governor McAlister to President Roosevelt recommending the continuation of the Farm Debt Adjustment program. Letter from President Roosevelt replying to McAlister's telegram.

The Farm Debt Adjustment program was an outgrowth of the Farm Credit Act of 1933 and the creation of the Farm Credit Administration that same year. The goal was to lower foreclosure rates by allowing farmers to refinance their mortgages at below-market interest rates and make payments over a longer period of time.
